description: Erection of a single storey side extension and the reconstruction of the existing single storey rear extension, a side and rear roof extension with two front roof windows incorporating the creation of a basement floor with a rear lightwell and the replacement of the existing windows
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from the date of this decision.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications: Unnumbered Location Plan, A739/L1, A739-PM01, A739-PM02, A739-PM03, A739-PM04, A739-PL01-A, A739-PL20, A739-PL21, A739-F01, Design and Access Statement, Photograph sheets. Received: 17/1/2024
A739-PL05. Received: 8/3/2024
A739-PL02-B. Received: 13/3/2024
A739-PL03-B and A739-PL04-B. Received: 21/3/2024

Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building, unless otherwise shown on the approved plans.
Condition : 4 - The basement hereby permitted shall at no time be used or occupied as a separate dwelling independent of the main house and shall not be used as sleeping accommodation.
Condition : 5 - The windows to be fitted on the front roof face of the dwelling shall be black-framed and traditional, conservation-style.

Condition : 6 - No development shall take place until a Construction Method Statement (CMS) relating to the basement hereby approved has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority. The CMS shall be certified by a qualified professional and give details of excavation, temporary works and construction techniques, including details of potential impacts on neighbouring land based on assessment of the geology and hydrology of the area. The approved CMS shall be adhered to throughout the construction period for the development.

Condition : 7 - Prior to the commencement of the basement, including any excavation works and site preparation, evidence should be provided which demonstrates how the basement will be made safe from flooding, and that it will not increase flood risk elsewhere. This should be in accordance with the requirements set out in the West London Strategic Flood Risk Assessment for basements located within Flood Zone 3a.
